text:
In case anyone here uses Authlite for MFA on a Server 2022 DC: The "2023-10 Cumulative Update for Microsoft server operating system version 21H2 for x64-based Systems" (KB5031364) makes changes in the kdcsvc.dll file on 2022 Domain Controllers that cause previous versions of AuthLite to break and prevent the DC from booting or authenticating users. * Install AuthLite 2.4.14
 or newer on your DCs to address this issue. * Even though the issue only affects the 2022 DCs, it is generally preferable
 to update all DCs to eventually have them all running the same build.
 * After installation, the DCs will not have problems with the 2023-10 update. * For the few customers previewing AuthLite v2.5 please contact us to get a
 link to an updated build. If your DCs applied the update already and you can't log in, the simplest workaround is: * mount the filesystem of the affected machine and rename the file
 c:\Windows\System32\CSALsubauth.dll to any other name (e.g. append an
 underscore). * After this, the AuthLite core will not load at next boot, and you should be
 able to boot and authenticate with your emergency break-glass account at
 least. * At that point you can install version 2.4.14
 (or newer),
 * and reboot, everything should work as before. ---- Steve Yates ITS, Inc. -- %40SN6PR08MB5517.namprd08.prod.outlook.com

metadata.topic: AUTHLITE ANNOUNCE: Install 2.4.14 (or later) on DCs, to prevent 2023-10 Windows Update issue
metadata.email_text_clean:

metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] AUTHLITE ANNOUNCE: Install 2.4.14 (or later) on DCs, to prevent 2023-10 Windows Update issue
metadata.noun_chunks: ["AuthLite for MFA on a Server 2022 DC", "2023-10 Cumulative Update for Microsoft server operating system version 21H2 for x64-based Systems"]
metadata.keywords: ["microsoft server operating system version 21h2", "2022 domain controllers"]
